scenario_1.persona_content: A parapsychologist who is passionate about exploring the realm of ESP and other unexplained phenomena. They have a deep interest in understanding how the mind can interact with the physical world and are always seeking out new evidence to support or refute the existence of ESP. They are well-versed in the scientific method and have a critical mindset when it comes to evaluating evidence. They are also an avid reader of psychological research and have a keen interest in the history of parapsychology.
scenario_1.thought: As a parapsychologist, I'm interested in how people's minds are connected and how we relate to one another. While the monetary value is slightly lower for me in the 'Right' option (400 vs 600), the equitable distribution of resources appeals to my sense of fairness and interconnectedness. I think there is an interesting experiment to be had by choosing the 'Right' option. I don't see any clear reason why I should want to take all of the money and leave the other person with none. It seems like the more fair thing to do is pick the 'Right' choice.

Considering my interest in how minds connect and interact, I am inclined to select the option that promotes fairness and potentially fosters a more positive interaction between individuals. I believe this aligns with my values, even if it means a slightly lower personal gain. Thus, I choose the left option.
